review_content: Bottled. Amber, light toasted head, medium carbonation. Nose of toasted raisin bread, plum, caramel. Flavor is tuggernuts between spicy hop bitterness and sweet smoked malt. Finishes with metal, smoke, nutmeg.
Caramel flavor combined with dark roasted fruits are the main ingredients.  Tastes like a typical German dark beer.  Decent.
Color ámbar oscuro. Aroma a tostado, sabor a toffe y levemente caramelo, justo amargor. Buen equilibrio pero no es sorprendente
Keg at The Portland International Beer Festival on 20/07/2008.  Dark sugars, banana and cloves in the aroma.  Moderate sweetness, but not saccharine.

330ml bottle. Clear, dark chestnut colour with ruby glimmer and small to average, thick, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, beige head. Sweet-ish, dark malty aroma, notes of malt lozenge, caramel, some toffee. Taste is sweet-ish and toasty, minimally nutty, dark malty, notes of malt lozenge, caramel, some toffee, a touch of nougat, minimal hop bitterness. Oily texture, smooth and soft palate, fine and gentle, soft carbonation. Good!

Dark reddish brown beer, thin head. Smells of malt and toffee. Flavour has a bit of those too with it being quite dry and toasty in the finish and the sweetness fading out altogether. It's decent but it'd feel better balanced if the sweetness kept up.
Found out of bottle. Pours a dark red with short lasting white foam. Really enjoyable malt flavors. Great option for winter.
330ml bottle. Dark Reddish brown with a moderate white head. Big roasted malt aroma, flavour is caramel, a little grass, and very much belies the ABV

330 ml bottle.bought in caza de la cerveza website. Dark color big head. Grass smell and cream. Good taste of caramel but not overly sweet. Good surprise for the smell. Trying to be complex on the end, not quite there but well dlne beer.

Dec 2019. 355ml green bottle, filtered, from BeerHawk as part of a £1 per bottle mystery case deal. Nice. A reasonably malty, reasonably strong lager. Quite clean, but the dark malts and the abv pump it up. Yeah, I'd buy this again for a £1!
Well reputed as one of the best doppelbocks. Lots of complex taste that supports the maltiness, quite drinkable despite its high ABV.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a teku glass. Clear deep ruby brown, small fizzy beige head, mostly diminishing. Aroma roasted malt, caramel, candy sugar, sugar syrup. Flavour light heavy sweet and medium bitter, roasted malt, caramel, raisin, candy sugar. Medium body, oily to sticky texture, soft carbonation, malty sweetbitter finish, light roast and caramelized sugar, much better than expected and also less boozy, good doppelbock.

Botella de 33 cl @ Saveur Biere online. Color marrón oscuro, oro viejo. Espuma beige abundante que se disipa rápidamente. Baja retención. 
Aroma a pasas, higos secos, malta tostada. En boca no es muy dulce, algo licorosa, fruta seca.
The darkest one of the variety. Lots of malt. Reminds me how much better American beer is than European. They beat us on tradition but their beer has been outdone by American microbrews.

Draught.  Pours dark brown with a small beige head.  Aroma is molasses, toffee, raisin, bread, brow sugar, and slight coffee.  Taste is molasses, raisin, coffee, brown sugar, and a little chocolate.  Medium+ body.  Medium carbonation.  Creamy-ish mouthfeel.  Need to retry - I remember this being better/less sweet.

Bottled. Amber, light toasted head, medium carbonation. Nose of toasted raisin bread, plum, caramel. Flavor is tuggernuts between spicy hop bitterness and sweet smoked malt. Finishes with metal, smoke, nutmeg.
Caramel flavor combined with dark roasted fruits are the main ingredients.  Tastes like a typical German dark beer.  Decent.
Color ámbar oscuro. Aroma a tostado, sabor a toffe y levemente caramelo, justo amargor. Buen equilibrio pero no es sorprendente
Keg at The Portland International Beer Festival on 20/07/2008.  Dark sugars, banana and cloves in the aroma.  Moderate sweetness, but not saccharine.

330ml bottle. Clear, dark chestnut colour with ruby glimmer and small to average, thick, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, beige head. Sweet-ish, dark malty aroma, notes of malt lozenge, caramel, some toffee. Taste is sweet-ish and toasty, minimally nutty,…

Dark reddish brown beer, thin head. Smells of malt and toffee. Flavour has a bit of those too with it being quite dry and toasty in the finish and the sweetness fading out altogether. It's decent but it'd feel better balanced if the sweetness kept up.
Found out of bottle. Pours a dark red with short lasting white foam. Really enjoyable malt flavors. Great option for winter.
330ml bottle. Dark Reddish brown with a moderate white head. Big roasted malt aroma, flavour is caramel, a little grass, and very much belies the ABV

330 ml bottle.bought in caza de la cerveza website. Dark color big head. Grass smell and cream. Good taste of caramel but not overly sweet. Good surprise for the smell. Trying to be complex on the end, not quite there but well dlne beer.

Dec 2019. 355ml green bottle, filtered, from BeerHawk as part of a £1 per bottle mystery case deal. Nice. A reasonably malty, reasonably strong lager. Quite clean, but the dark malts and the abv pump it up. Yeah, I'd buy this again for a £1!
Well reputed as one of the best doppelbocks. Lots of complex taste that supports the maltiness, quite drinkable despite its high ABV.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a teku glass. Clear deep ruby brown, small fizzy beige head, mostly diminishing. Aroma roasted malt, caramel, candy sugar, sugar syrup. Flavour light heavy sweet and medium bitter, roasted malt, caramel, raisin, candy…

Botella de 33 cl @ Saveur Biere online. Color marrón oscuro, oro viejo. Espuma beige abundante que se disipa rápidamente. Baja retención. Aroma a pasas, higos secos, malta tostada. En boca no es muy dulce, algo licorosa,…
The darkest one of the variety. Lots of malt. Reminds me how much better American beer is than European. They beat us on tradition but their beer has been outdone by American microbrews.

Draught. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is molasses, toffee, raisin, bread, brow sugar, and slight coffee. Taste is molasses, raisin, coffee, brown sugar, and a little chocolate. Medium+ body. Medium carbonation. Creamy-ish mouthfeel. Need…
Nice aroma, small head, good malt taste.  Pours a nice dark brown in color.  Nice full body, but doesn't feel heavy. very easy drinking.
Wonderful full flavoured, complex, strong. Beautiful beer, my style. online saveaur bier

330 ml bottle from Beer Hawk's mystery case, bb 07/2019 so ok.
Red/brown, clear, pale beige head.
Nose - raisins, dried figs, malts.
Taste - bittersweet, follows the nose.
12 oz bottle, pours reddish brown clear.  Medium body, aroma of dark fruits and malt.  Bready raisin taste with slightly bitter finish.

Appearance of coca cola and some of the sweetness too. Figs and licorice in the flavour with heavy malt backbone and some marmite umami. Morello cherry tartness stops it being over the top in my opinion. I like this style anyway and thought this was an interesting and worthy example.

355ml green bottle. Pours a clear red-brown with a large, creamy, short lived, tan head that laces. Sweet aroma of toasted bready malt, caramel, raisin, prune and brown sugar. Sweet flavour of toasted bready malt, caramel, toffee, raisin, prune and mild chocolate in a dry, mild bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice, ABV is well integrated.

From a beer hawk mystery case.  Pours dark brown like Coca Cola.  Thin head. Little aroma.  Very sweet malty liquid. Taste of caramel , banana, toffee , brown sugar, malts.  Way too sweet for my palate and not enough hops. Cloying. Not my favourite. But at £1 a bottle from beerhawk it was ok ! Would not buy at full price. I will stick to IPAs , from the brewing capital (Burton, England ) and similar hoppy beers.

Avec un alcool uniquement 7,6 %, ce qui n'est pas très élevé pour le genre, la brasserie Spaten réussit ici à nous livrer une Doppelbock d'une belle complexité, d'une bonne intensité et corpulence avec un équilibre tout à fait remarquable où amertume et alcool s'associent pour donner à la fois fraîcheur et caractère. Le sucre est de surcroît moins présent que d'autres bières du genre, ce qui permet une légèreté certaine que j'ai particulièrement apporté. De fait, la texture est plus fine sans que cela soit gênant toutefois. Le visuel sur une brun acajou limpide est également sympathique. Absence quasi totale de mousse toutefois. L'effervescence est pour sa part peu poussée. Très joli nez, dense et riche sur le raisin, la prune, une pointe de pomme, le miel, la mélasse et le caramel et avec de surcroit un superbe duo amertume/alcool. Nous retrouvons cette même complexité et ce même équilibre dès l'attaque. De légères épices s'ajoutent au cocktail. Intensité et ampleur sont au rendez-vous. La deuxième bouche voit à la fois l'amertume croître quelque peu et l'alcool, parfaitement intégré poser davantage l'ensemble. L’arrière-bouche voit l'alcool se renforcer encore davantage, conférant ainsi du caractère à la bière. Le final, même s'il est d'une bonne longueur aurait tout de même mérité d'être soit renforcé soit d'être plus flamboyant. Belle gourmandise.

Bottle shared courtesy of Daniel Tomlinson in Bluebell Bar on a windy summer evening - Thanks!
Thin fluffy head left a cover on a mahogany coloured still body.
Caramel, malt & demerara aroma.
Medium bodied, so smooth on the palate with a sparkling back.
Treacle toffee, caramel, biscuit, malt, brown sugar, spices & liquorice tastes.
Very nice,
Bottle from beerhawk. Coco-cola appearance. Aroma is caramel, malt, cherry and roasted. Flavour is smooth, crisp, herbal, dark fruits, cherry, malt and caramel.

24-06-2019; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their December 2018 discovery box).
The beer looks nice. Chestnut brown, crystal clear and with a nice soft almost creamy light brown layer of foam. Foam retention is average. Looks like a proper Doppelbock. 
The aromas of the beer are great. The malts give caramel, toffee, some roast and some liquorice. It is warm and full. The hops give some rather herbal aromas. Nothing clear, but just a warming herbal ness. Yeast gives some fruity esters. There are some touches of banana in the distance. Also quite some spicy yeast. I like the touches of dried fruit in the beer and there slightly rough hops and yeast notes. It has some power to it. 
The taste of the beer is nice. Sweet malts, with also a bitter toasty malts, bitter hops and some savoury notes from the roast. The beer is well balanced. Nice one. 
The palate of the beer also is nice. Full body, smooth texture with even a creamy component. Carbonation is average. The finish of the beer is nice. It has nice red fruit and caramel, together with a slight spicy hop thing. All in all, a very nice beer. Definitely worth a place in the monthly  discovery box by Saveur Bière.

Botella 0,33l  Color marron oscuro-rojizo,espuma blanca,fina,alta,poco resistente.Aroma malta,caramelo,frutos secos.Sabor dulce,oleosa,fuerte,maltosa,caramelo,frutos secos,amargor entra ultimo,suave.Un Doppelbock muy bueno

Bottle. Clear mahogany color with an off-white fizzy head. Aromas are malty with clear melanoidins, note of caramel, brown sugar, hazelnuts, caramelized apple. Taste is sweet but balanced, quite sticky and flavorful. Good body, medium to high carbonation. Tasty Doppelbock.
Aroma acaramelado, sabor dark agradable al paladar, no muy intensi pero de sabor marcado.

Candy malt sweet candy burnt smooth Carmel. Good head. Nice head. Sweet. Medium head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle (I thought all imports were 11.2?). Nice roasted malt scent, faint hints of coffee and chocolate, touch of banana. The green bottle is deceiving, the beer is very dark brown. Taste is malty, with a hint of chocolate, some booze. Subtle hint of hops. Sweet smooth finish. A heavier beer, not one for the beach, but rather for sitting back and ending the day.

Bottle at home. Beautiful dark red to red-brown color, medium sized tan head. Aroma and flavor is malts, sweetish caramelish, caramelised sugars, lightly brown malts. Decent body and carbonation. Nice, well done. 7-4-7-4-15.
Dark bown pour with a thin head. Aroma is malty/bready. Flavor is crisp and similar to its aroma. Very nice.

Cerveza negra fuerte con mucha espuma. En boca tiene un sabor a cereal, con matices similares al fernet.
Acompañado con maní extra sal

Robe ambré très très sombre, limpide, belle mousse éphémère, ne reste même pas un disque complet. Nez vineux, fruit sec et caramel. En bouche, c'est sucré et très alcoolisé, on sent du vin cuit, de fruit sec (figue, raisin), et une pointe de caramel salé. C'est très corpulent, ça tapisse la bouche malgré une texture plutôt fluide. On est loin d'avoir du sirop de sucre, malgré une indéniable charpente. Notes de café en finale. Grosse longueur en bouche.

Bouteille de 35,5 cL achetée sur Saveur Bière. Robe ambrée sombre avec une mousse brune éphémère. Arômes de caramel, malts grillés. Texture légèrement crémeuse, carbonatation moyenne. Notes de caramel, cassonade, malts torréfiés, alcool. Fin sur le caramel.
Più bock che doppelbock, color rosso scuro, pochissima schiuma e bassa carbonazione. Gusto classico per una bock: tostato, liquirizia, caramello..senza demeritare, ma anche senza eccellere.

Аромат классический для стиля, очнеь много солода, как и карамельного так и немного жженого, легкие нотки какого сладкого карамельного сиропа. Цвет темно коричневый, пенка неплохая, мелкопузырчатая. Вкус питкий, хотя крепость пива ощущается. Вкус по большей части карамельный с легкими прожаренными нотками солода. Послевкусие с хмелем, хотя сильно не горчит, даже вообще не ощущается какая то резкость во вкусе от хмеля лишь легкое покалывание и терпкость, но постоянная. После глотка немного водянисто чем нужно. Легкая першистость как у темного лагера. Сладость от карамели и снова какого то сиропа, эти нотки от сиропа лишь слегка дисбалансируют вкус.

This beer has potential, and am sorta liking Spaten.  Wouldn't say is my favorite dobblebock, but the price for an imported 7.2% can't really be beat.  Sampled this for a single, then just saw today Total Wine and More has a 6-pack for about $7.50.  Almost bit, but gonna wait and get a 6 down the road for sure.  Mostly malty brown here, minor hops at the end.  For 7.2% you would think the alcohol would be somewhat masked, but sorta stands out...in a good way though.   Not something I would want to drink all year long, but here and there splitting 6-pack with a friend sounds good to me.
De Hopt. En copa Teku. Viendo Westworld 1x10. Unidimensional. Caramelo bastante tostado y poco mas. Da la sensacion de no estar muy fresca
Cerveza alemana oscura, muy bien equilibrada y con la espuma justa. Tonos finales a regaliz y un toque de alcohol nada molesto. Se bebe muy fácilmente, muy buena.
Una scura doppio malto da 7.6 gradi. Un po' troppo amara per i miei gusti...
Birra ambrata scura, dopplebock ma dai sapori leggeri.. Essendo una dopplebock, mi aspettavo sapori e profumi più.. "potenti"

Bottle from Hopt. Aroma is dark malt with burned caramel, dried fruits, some roast, hint of liquorice. Flavour is medium sweet with a mild bitterness. Body is above medium. Adequately robust Doppelbock.

Dark brown with a small head that quickly disappears to nothing.
Aroma of malt,dried dark fruits and raisins 
Tastes pretty much like it smells but with a definate taste of alcohol. Very nice beer but one is enough

Bottle 0,355ltr; Clear dark brown coloured brew with an red glow. Neutral sweet bitter taste with neutral hints of caramel and rusted malts.  Yes its from Spaten and their beers are mostly neutral  and not bad.

German. Pours dark clear amber with a slight red hue. Nose is toasted nuts, dried fruit, caramel, raisin. Taste is more of same with hint of marmalade on toast. Nice degree of sweetness with dry wine like finish. A solid doppel bock!
Reddish colour, almost completely dark, creamy head with low retention, sweet toasted aroma, full body, sweet flavour.
Think may be my first doppelbock and lovely maltiness comes through. Nice looker and nice malty nose. Caramel and toffee full flavour.  Quite winey too. Beginning to taste strength. Sipper.
(beau nez fruité (cassis, µ-banane), cara-érable, bouche moyen-dense, malt engagé, bel-amer dès back, se détériore)

Appearance-  Clear dark amber colour with large but weak brown foam. 
  Aromas-  Strong notes of fresh and moist home baked rye bread as well as honey, caramel and various sweet malts. 
  Palate-  Full/medium body with oily and smooth texture.
  Taste-  Sweet and very bready with notes of rye, caramel, straw and seeds. 
  Overall-  Rather easy going, sweet and bready rather simple but really enjoyable.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Total Wine & More, Danvers. Appearance is clear, ruby-brown with tons of sparkle, finger-width beige head with fair retention and no lacing. Aroma is bread, caramel, tart and sweet fruit. Taste is as aroma with some pleasant alcohol. Palate is medium bodied with smooth, thick texture, soft-to-average carbonation and finish as taste. Overall, true to style and good.
Pours clear amber with a thin head. Aroma of herbs. Very sweet taste of malt, some slight pine influences. Palate includes spices and more of the malt. Excellent beer.

Draft at Schilo's, San Antonio, TX, USA. Pours dark reddish brown, with limited foam. Aroma is malty, weak caramel. Body is fairly dense, with moderate carbonation. Taste is pretty sweet, but enjoyable. Finish is average, only some malty feeling left.
Strong malt - caramel and raisin. Low hops and bitterness. Sweet, alcohol mouthfeel. Dark brown color, small tan head. A good, solid doppelbock.
From backlog. Bottle at The Phoenix Club, Anaheim, Ca. Amber with offwhite head. Malts, hops, Caramel. Nice!
Backlog. Bottle a few times over the years. Roasted malt aromas with some grassy hop notes. Roasted malt with some pretty strong bitterness and dryness on the finish. Not bad.

Bottle recently but definitely had this jawn 6-8 years ago. Pours amber with a medium sized khaki top. Notes are caramel malt, cocoa, roasted grain, fruit, and german earth. Expected the finish to be on the sweeter side but its somewhat bitter from the roast and hops. Prost

Strong aroma
Light small head
Reddish brown color with clarity
Light bite on tongue
Heavy malt and wheat flavor
Lingering aftertaste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pleasant surprise. Pours chestnut brown. Malt on the nose. Nutty taste with malt backbone. Like this a lot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice caramel aroma and copper brown color. After having drank beers that have such a dark, burnt malt flavor, this actually has a refreshing, sweet taste. There is a decent amount of carbonation. I like to enjoy this with food in order to balance the malty sweetness. I buy this as part of a mixed 6-pack and drink one while eating crackers, aged cheese, and salami.

12 oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head that is gone quickly. Scents of alcohol, nuts and brown bread. Taste of hazelnut and pumpernickel. Alcohol is not apparent and the finish is a nice sour of medium length. Medium to low carbonation. Nice effort.

Dark ruby brown color, beige head. Malty aroma, mild toffee. Light body, apples, toffee. Drying finish with a pear acidity to it. It tastes more like a heller bock or maibock to me than the more robust doppelbocks from the region (Weltenberg, Andechs or Ayinger). Pretty cool.

A fine examples of Germany brewing.I have spent the last 15 years enjoying this fine brew.I have brewed beer since 1964. I have never been able to recreate this fine brew. Trying it and your will thank me.
Clear and brown with frothy head. Sweet aroma of treacle malts and a hint of soy sauce (?). Very smooth chocolatey malt taste. Very thick. Almost like Milo. Sits very well.
Chugged a 12oz of this in a few seconds. Ass drippings, malt of gay mayne. Good cock penetration. Nice and smooth. Full.
really good stuff, on par with paulaner and celebrator. thick sweet boozy and smooth. decent price too. cant go wrong

Pours a dark brown color. One finger brown head. Okay retention, good lacing.

Aroma is worchestire sauce. Bready, sweet. Sorghum. Smells odd, but very good.

Taste is malty and sweet. Sorghum. Rich and malty.

Mouthfeel is medium full. Heavy and sweet. Easy to drink.

Overall, this is great. I’m enjoying it. I would recommend, and I would buy it again.
Good doppelbock. Rich, caramel, full bodied. A touch sweet, but it works for me.

A bit much. Heavy bread flavor.  Yes, the German "liquid bread" description for this brew is accurate.   I like malt, but this is a bit much for me. A good beer that doesnt mind if it is warm or cold - tastes great either way. I liked it, but wont enjoy it often.  It is a bit much, even for my love of malty beers.

Thanks for a site that doesnt force everyone to follow "their way" of rating beers according to how many pine cones and nutmeg have been added to the 150 lbs of hops per bottle. Those sites claim to be your "advocate", but they do little other than sell ads to you and force you to bow to their "wisdom".

From Mar 2007

Pours from 16.9oz bottle a deep amber with a medium sized head of foam that shrinks to just a ring around the edge of the glass and a little lacing.

The smell is of caramel malt.

The taste on first sip has a huge malt character. Lots of roastiness and grain with just a bit of caramel. Further sips in and I'm getting some of the alcohol but it's not intrusive; also, there's some chocolate and fruitness there, mostly a plum flavour that shows up mostly near the finish which itself ends up slightly on the bitter side. It certainly is smooth enough and easy drinking so I'll have to watch it...;^)

Bottom line: This is a good Doppelbock that is worthy of a try.
On tap. Roasty and slightly creamy aroma. Sharp fruity taste. Boozy finish. It's fine.

Bottle from Merchants. Extra green bottle smell. Aroma is slightly metallic, caramel, some booze, skunked, some toffee, maybe earthy hop, eh. Appearance is reddish brown, light tan head, clear. Taste is caramel, metallic, booze, industrial, unpleasant. Mouthfeel is medium , light carbonation, metallic caramel aftertaste. Overall, not good.

Just had a bottle but I am really buzzed. I think it's just wonderful. Will have to try again straight as a first beer

Nice complexity but overly sweet. Earthy. roasted malt forward with a slight bitter finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark chestnut with light head and minimal lacing.  Aroma is toffee and maltiness.  Taste is immediate nutty flavor with slight hint of spice.  Aftertaste is slightly bitter hoppiness building.  A smooth beer, but not particularly complex.
Smells amazing. Has a very malty taste with hints of caramel. Not bitter at all, but not too sweet either. Has a rich roast/toffie smell. Very enjoyable especially in cooler weather.

For the price and ABV, it's hard to beat. This is likely my backup beer in case I was to drink two in a night. I like to open with a fruit based IPA, and then use this as reserve. It's only $9 and 7.6% ABV. You wish Guiness would put together a package like this for price and six beers, but alas. Mostly it's a malty slop of beer, which is what I want sometimes. It's also eminently drinkable.
12oz bottle at home. Dark brown with a fading beige head. Sweet dark malt, roasted notes, toast. Moderate carbonation. Thick, sweet malt finish. Very good.

Twelve ounce bottle from mix 6 pack purchased at Ingles Supermarket in Lake Lure, North Carolina, tasted on July 24, 2017. Cola color, big roasted malt nose, good malty taste with some complexity but compromised by astringency. Maybe the megabrewer has changed this beer, and not for the better.
Dark pour with a thin but tight head. Sweet and malty with lots of dark fruit.

Not much of a nose. Looks like Coca Cola. Taste is complex, lots of caramel. Medium body with a creamy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark brown/plum with little carbonation. Taste is sweet plum with a very smooth ending
Color: Dark, small foamy head. Aroma: malty and rich. Taste: bready, toasty, very little hops. Palette: viscous, thick, almost chewy. My favorite doppelbock.

Brown almost black in color. Licorice tasting, but not in a good way. Tastes so bad I had to grimace on every sip. I did finally finish the bottle, but it was a chore. Troegenator is my benchmark to compare other Dopplebocks and this one isn’t even in the same league.

On tap at Plattduetsche Park biergarten(Oktoberfest). 
Murky brown color with nutty aroma. Taste of sweet malt, toffee and chestnuts.

small frothy offwhite head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. clear average-density dark-brown with ruby highlights body. aroma: moderate malty, raisin, wood. initial flavor: moderate sweet. final flavor: moderate sweet light bitter acidic; average duration. palate: medium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation, light astringent alcoholic finish. forte dulçor maltado lembrando frutas secas, leve aquecimento alcoolico, leve acidez final lembra ameixa fresca, balanceando o conjunto. A acidez não esta prevista nas bjcp, mas em minha opinião aparece como plus em um conjunto que caso contrário poderia ser enjoativo. 75 s

Draft at Shoal Creek Tavern. Dark brown, with lasting off-white head. Rich, malty aroma. Notes of coffee flavor in the malty backbone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas of toffee and bread. Taste is berries, toffee, and bread, with a tad bit of smoke and wet leaves in the end.

Sometimes it just does not connect.The 12 oz. bottle gave up a dark, almost black, liquid with a head that has to be coaxed with the pour. How do I describe the nose, medicinal, perhaps. An improvement with the taste, but only so much. Malt heavy, an astringent edge, a glimmer of sweetness following. Just not my style, Just not my beer.

Btl pours a dark brown color with a dense soft, off white head that hangs around leaving spots of lace on glass. Aromas of dark bread,grain,herbal hops, and whiff of alcohol. Tastes of sweet caramel, dates,malt and spicy hops. Full body, nice carbonation, slick, smooth mouthfeel and a sweet-spicy finish. This beer has a really comfortable taste. It is very easy to drink with nice homely flavors. It’s a little sweet but the hops and alcohol balance it out nicely. It is simple yet elegant. Great winter warmer!

It pours brown with a brown head. It has a very deep rich malt aroma. There are flavors highlight by toast with some dark fruit. The flavors are sweet, rich and clean They feature toast, malts, and hints of dark fruits. It has a full body that is smooth with some alcohol warming. Overall this is a highly malted beer with little hops, but clean and flavorful.
Tap at Mader’s. Very dark with no head. Smells like dark raisin bread, but dry, and maybe a little hint of chocolate. Flavor follows.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a dark copper color with a small tan head. The aroma is malt and caramel. The taste is an excellent match to the aroma with a small amount of hops. An excellent beer.

There was a time I drank this beer with my old pal Chris Blado, god rest his wisconsin soul. We were playing music in the old Atlatl studio, thats a place of worship for you yahoo numbskulls who don’t know an ant eater from an aardvark. I remember enjoying myself and then really enjoying myself. Feeling very drunk. This sweet beer, malty, smooth, pantry full of caramel, sneaks up on you. With a APV of almost 8% a couple of these will put petite men, like Chris and I, under the table fast.

Tap (PiwPaw Beer Heaven, Warsaw)

Sweet fruity aroma, dark fruits. Rich maltiness too. Tastes extremely malty, but the palate is quite light. Goes down remarkably easily. Malts almost kvassy. A malt overload - nicey-nice!
Nothing spectacular but a good decent beer. ABV is 7.6% which is good. Although I prefer an 8.0% or higher. Nevertheless, has a good taste to it.
Sits great on the tongue. Nice dark color with a roasted flavor. It’s fairly high in alcohol so that never hurts, right?
Bottle - no label taken. Can’t believe I haven’t rated this before - Pours dark brown - nose/taste of caramel, some dark fruit and toffee -med body
Bottle. Mahogany in color with a thin beige head. Aroma of dark fruit and roasted malt. Sweet caramel flavor was also present.

Bottle @ home. Cellared 2,5 years. Dark red color with an off white medium head. Small bubbles and no lacing. Malty and very fruity aroma. Moderately vinous with slight hints of cardboard. Lots of maltiness, caramel toffee and fruits in the taste, similar to the aroma. Some alcohol in the finish. Has aged well and recently peaked.

Reviewing a doppelbock at the end of summer might not be a completely fair review. However, I have had Spaten Optimator many times in the past and it’s only been slightly better than the bottle I’m reviewing now. This is definitely a German doppelbock personified – plenty of sweet malty notes, slightly nutty, but some bitterness to balance it out. Not bad for an InBev product.



I poured a 12oz bottle into a mug. It was bottled on 2/2/14 and cost $2.50 ($0.21 per ounce).



Appearance: Beautiful chestnut/mahogany hue. Translucent with carbonation visible. Pours to a two-finger, tan, foamy head which laces and retains somewhat well.



Smell: Slight skunkiness from the green bottle; otherwise very malty with an overt lager character.



Taste: The first thing I notice here is the classic macro lager character. While I’m quite sure Spaten Optimator is an all-malt brew, there’s something to it that screams “lager!” as soon as it touches the tongue. It’s actually quite tangy at first, maybe even a little sour (I’m chalking that up to green bottle and lightstrike), but it’s easily overlooked. Once I get invested in the palette I start to notice flavors of roasted peanuts, a touch of caramel, maybe toffee. The doppelbock style is actually not too far off from the brown ale style in terms of flavor characteristics and this beer is a good example of that. There’s still some bitterness here, but actual hop flavor is mild. Slightly dry, maybe even a bit metallic. Again, this is a fairly old bottle, so I’ll bet a fresh serving would be more complex and less flawed, but as it stands it’s still pretty good for a relatively inexpensive import made by a macro brewery.



Drinkability: Spaten Optimator may taste like and ale, but it drinks like the lager it is. The mouthfeel is thin and crisp, but not overly fizzy. There’s a slightly slick or sour aftertaste, but I don’t mind it. At 7.6% ABV there is mild warmth from the alcohol, and it does play a factor in the taste as well. It doesn’t feel as heavy as those numbers would indicate, but one serving is satisfactory to be sure.
Bottle. Pours clear dark ruby with very small off white head. Nose is brown sugar and raisin. Taste is nice dark fruit. Great mouthfeel.
Dark and heavily spiced. Lots of aroma and flavor. Lots of savory with a little bit of sweetness.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice khaki head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and caramel. Taste is sweet malt, dark fruit, caramel, and a touch of chocolate. Very nice!

12oz bottle. Deep brown color with a beige head that goes away quickly. Aroma is prunes, some tropical fruit. Taste is sweet dried fruit, some tropical fruit, some chocolate, roasty malt. I haven’t tried many doppelbocks, but I enjoyed this beer and would have it again.

Single bottle from W&M Mansfield. Pours out a deep ruby brown color. Light tan head that goes away to nothing. Intense aroma of earthy fruits and malts. Flavor is smooth and earthy. Some toffee, some caramel, some chocolate, some berries and cherries. Well balanced. Gets better with each sip!
Malziger, leicht oxidierter Antrunk. Wenig schokoladig, süffig, weich würzig. Mit der Zeit vollmundiger, leichte Herbe. Gelungen! 11/11/10/11/9/11
Very rich and filling and stuffed with fruits and berries. Some carefully hidden mild alcohol. Long finish without bitterness.

Bottle from backlog. 
Dark brown with a beige head. 
Aroma: malty, earthy, light floral, toffee. 
Taste: candy, licorice, malty, light earthy.

Bottle at home. Aroma has fortified wine, dried figs, prune juice, raisins, toast. Full bodied with a rounded mouth feel. Medium carbonation. Flavor of oxidized malts, fig compote, oloroso sherry, fresh wet bread dough. Lightly bitter finish. A great specimen of a style that I don’t seek out often enough.

Bottle. Pours cola brown with creamy beige head. Aroma is cookie, caramel, and toasted malts, fig, light dates, and faint vanilla. Flavor is bready malts, sweet dark fruit notes, light hop bitterness, and some caramel notes; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

From a bottle. Pours very dark brown with a bubbly off white head. Tastes like dry raisins, booze, toast, light tobacco and ash. Light/medium.body and carbonation. Light aroma of dried dark fruits, alcohol, tobacco, and earth.

I have no idea what the hell Optimator means but it’s a badass name that fits this brew nicely. Once you get this doppelbock out of the shitty green bottle it has a seductive dark body with a generous tan head. The aroma consists of warm booze and fruity, complex malt tones. The flavor is rich and slightly roasty at the start. At the middle of the mouth, there’s a hell of a lot going on - candy-like sweetness, dark fruit, toffee, chocolate - it’s all there. Finish is a little spicy which is nice because it helps to offset the maltiness. I was very impressed by the variety of aromas and tastes that this lager had to offer. I’d love to have one more and take another crack at identifying all of the nuanced flavors. Seriously though, Spaten, this beer deserves better than a green bottle.

Poured a dark mahogany, almost brown color with one finger of tan head. No lacing along the sides of the glass. No retention on the top.

Smelled that 7.60% ABV right away. Also got caramel, toffee, plum, amber malts, light raspberry, light cherry and purple grapes.

Tasted a bit darker than the nose. Still that berry - raspberry, cherry and juniper - caramel and plum. 

Medium body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Long finish.

Really liked this one. Wouldn’t hesitate to try it again later.
Draft @ Gustav’s (PDX). Big malty aroma. Dark brown color, with a hint of red. Wonderful full bloodied, malty flavor. My favorite German beer!

The body has a deep brownish mahogany color with a dark reddish amber hue and good clarity. On top there is an average size (about 1 finger thick) light tan head. It is slow fading and leaves behind good lacing on the glass. The aroma has a sweet almost fruity nose with some dark grin notes and a slight hint of a mild sweet alcohol. The flavor has a big sweet malty character and full body with notes of caramel roasted grain and toffee. Hop bitterness is very light and really only comes out a little bit in the finish. There is also the slight presence of a mellow alcohol that adds a little more complexity to the overall character. The palate has a slick full mouth feel with soft carbonation.

Bitterness rounding the beer off.M: Medium body, slightly sticky. O: Meal for Lent. I think I could survive on it if I had to. The taste is pretty darn sweet, notice the licorice flavor that I saw before and some alcohol astringency. Very bitter on the back of the palate, there’s something lacking the balance of the beer. Rated in 2010.

From a 355ml greeen glass bottle pours a root beer colored liquid with a very small white head which quickly recedes. Aroma of malt and butterscotch. Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation. From BA review rated on 2-11-12 - 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance – Pours a brown with a big billowy off white head. The head fades to a thin film, with some nice lacing on the glass.
Smell – Bready and sweet, with a heavy roasted malt aroma mixed with quite a bit of caramel.

Taste – Bready with a roasted malt flavor initially. This is soon met with some sweet brown sugar and caramel flavors in the middle of the taste. The sweetness intensifies at the taste experience advances with it leaving a very pleasant sugar flavor on the tongue as the last drops of the beer work their way down your throat. A nice dopplebock flavor.

Mouthfeel –The body is creamy and the carbonation is quite right. The body of the beer coats the mouth without too much stickiness; making it very drinkable. The carbonation only enhances the drinkability; it complements the thicker-smooth body with a lighter carbonation which tingles the tongue in just the right way. 

Overall – Very drinkable and enjoyable. A classic dopplebock in my opinion.

(Bottle) Reddish brown colour with dense, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of caramel, red fruit, prunes, brown sugar, dark rye bread, liquorice and a touch of chocolate. More than medium body, with balanced sweetness. Tasty and well balanced doppelbock. Nice one.

Huge malt, not very complex, but otherwise nice and cleat bock.
Bottles, pours dark brown with a cream color head. Tastes sweet with a little bit of bitterness. Good beer.
From 17oz bottle to dimpled mug. Nose is heavy roasted malt.taste is medium-heavy body that’s mostly sour. Finishes smooth with a bite of alcohol. Awesome beer
bottle. brown with small head. chocolate, caramel and fruit. dopplebocks are probably my least favorite style of beer, but this isn’t bad.

Nice bready, malty aroma. Very clear amber with very little head that did not linger. Very subtly alcoholic, malty sweetness with low bitterness in the finish. Clean and well fermented beer. Excellent.

Pours a dark ruby red, almost brown, with a good head and lacing. The nose is dark fruit (plums, raisins), caramel and toffee against a sweet biscuit background. As it warms, prunes are at the forefront. Full medium body with a nice smooth texture that approaches slick. The carbonation level is low normal. The flavor profile is complex and well balanced. It begins with dark fruit, progresses to toffee/caramel and ends with a rich toasty sweetness. The finish is smooth with a nice burst of sweetness and a slight tingle of alcohol at the back of the throat. An outstanding doppelbock.
Medium sweetness, full body, creamy, average carbonation. One of my all-time favorite beers. Dopplebocks rule!
Bottle from Trader Joe’s. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, grain. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness. Good mouthfeel.

Bottle - Pours a very dark brown with a nice off-white head. Aromas of hay and grass. It’s a healthy 7.6% alcohol, but it has a nice smooth flavor with more hop bite than I’d expect based on the aroma. Nice beer.
Characteristic fruitiness, mild vanilla, medium hop bite, mild astringency, thin head. Very well balanced, real nice mouth feel. Classic Doppelbock.
Pours a deep drown with a medium off white head. Aroma of sweet malts and caramel. Tatse is malt dominant with a good caramel flavor, finish is well balanced with hops. Great beer, well crafted.
Rich, heavy, and not overly powerful. A good doppelbock, despite doppelbock not being my favorite style.
Optimator is my favorite doppel. It’s rich, medium-heavy, and not overly alcoholic.
Pours with a big head. Comes out dark, but can almost see through. Aroma is very hoppie (sp?). Very creamy flavor and strong.
Pours a deep brown with a creamy white head. Big malts and molasses and not much else. Tasty but a little rich for me.

Gave it a Euro-pour right down the middle of the glass. Built a tall, beige head. Real, rich brown color. Less than average lace after sipping. Aroma was that sweet, malty smell you’d expect from a doppel. Flavor was the same. Definitely sweet, no bitter hop flavor...plum or raisin notes, maybe? I could barely pick up the higher alcohol content. Carbonation was less than average and mouthfeel was decent. The viscosity was medium and not a long aftertaste. This is a classic version of the style. Shouldn’t disappoint most that are looking to sample a decent doppelbock.
Great smooth beer. High on malt taste, but not bitter. Good mouth feel and goes down smooth.
Bottle->willi becher. Dark brown with medium lite tan head. A: malty, with grains, grass, brown sugar. T: bittersweet malt, with both roast and caramel, grains, molasses, burnt sugar. Good.

Doppel rivalry: Spaten vs. Paulaner. The other rivalry match-up that occurred today makes me need a drink. In this games, everyone wins. Aroma of earthy malt and candied black cherries. Dark cola like appearance, except rather still. Sweet dark fruit taste, doesn’t feel so strong and to be fair it isn’t. at lest relatively speaking. Medium body, slick feel. A very good introduction to doppelbocks. For export only...strange InBev trickery.

0,5 l bottle from Systembolaget. A dense lightly tanned head, atop a clear ruby-brown body. Initial aroma is light acidic-fruity, followed by a scent caramel and dark bread, and a wee note of nuts and licorice. Body is medium full. Soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Not very sweet-flavored, yet flavorfull with a big malt base. Taste of dark caramel, rounded roast, with a light pepper tone and hint of dark dried fruits and licorice. Low bitterness. Finish is surprisingly short, bordering on watered down. Overall, a more then decent beer with lot of fine Doppelbock qualities.

Bottle: Poured a burgundy edged brown with a frothy light tan head. Aroma is rich with roasted malts, some stickiness in the nose as well. Taste is sweet caramel and roasted malt, not sugary, very smooth ans some fruit like character as well in the finish.

Reviewed from notes on 07/07/10
$2 for 33cl @ Huck’s in Spokane, WA.

Poured from bottle to snifter.

A: Pours dark cherry brown with excellent clarity. No head, appears flat.

S: Smells like a symphony bar! Toffee, cocoa, toast. Very pleasant.

T: Surprisingly bitter given the nose. Rye toast, cocoa, toffee still there, just not as evident as before. Slight earthen flavor.

M: Low carb flows well over tongue and after sweetness feel, but dries quickly and dries with the bitterness.

D: A bit thin for the style IMO, prefere a bit more body. Otherwise, strong offering from a classic brewery.

Serving type: bottle

12-23-2010

Bottle from AEON Mall Kumiyama. Good toasty malt nose, with light prunes and burnt sugar. Clear brown color with ruby highlights. Light roast malt initial, solid caramel base / alc. warms the palate / finish is fruity, sweet, and smooth. Medium body. A very tasty doppelbock. Not cloying, as some of them tend to be.

Bottle into glass. Pours a clear dark brown with a light tan head. Malty, sweet aroma. Medium mouthfeel. Tastes of dark malt and over ripe fruit with a clean finish. An excellent doppelbock, as long as the ones you grab aren’t light-struck.

Pour from bottle. Deep amber in color with moderate tan head. Very malty with a rich clean sweetness. Not my style but good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Duft av vørter og krydder. Tynt lag skum. Mør brun nesten sort farge. Smak av vørter.

Bottle picked up at the local state store 

Clear dark ruby/brown with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is toasted malts and chocolate. Flavors of roasted malts, caramel and rich chocolate 

Smooth and easy drinking

Dark brown with light tan head. Aroma caramel malt and some fruit. Medium body. Sweet malt flavor up front, then some cherry-like fruit develops, then the finish is just a little dry. Pretty complex and very well balanced and drinkable. Excellent.
One of the better doppelbocks I’ve had. Deep brown color, thick head, with a rich toffee and cocoa aroma. Sweet and slick on the tongue.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Aromas of toasty caramel malts, a little fruity, and faintly dusty Dark clear mahogany-ruby with a mostly fading off-white head. Dry, with caramel and toast in the forefront, some earthy hops to balance. Light-medium bodied, somewhat creamy, and finishes with notes of vanilla and caramel.

A doppelbock that can't be missed! Beginning with a nice fairly strong fruity and malty aroma along with a ruby brown color, this beer looks impressive. The flavor and balance between malty and sweet fruit notes does not disappoint and also hits the palate with a pleasant intensity. Concludes on a sweet cherry taste with surprisingly little bitterness. I enjoyed this brew, though the mouthfeel and body struck me as a bit thin and light. Distinct from its neighbor Paulaner Salvator in this regard, which i recall having a fuller body. That being said, it's still above and beyond average.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with a off white head. Taste sweet, cherries, plums. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle it is a cola brown Colorado with a slight head. The aroma is Malthus and has the smell of raisins. The taste is very sweet like dried cherries that ingers on the palate

From a 33 cl bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a clear dark amber with an ecru head. Malty nose redolent of raisins. Sweet flavors of plums and cherries. Medium bodied, high carbonation, Smooth, moderately sweet finish with some bitter notes.
Poured a dark mahogany with very little brown head. Roasted malts offset with a stone fruit undertone. Very nicely done.

Pours a rich mahogany with ruby hues. Bright clarity and bubbles rising to the top continually. A half finger of foam that fell quickly and left only a thin ring and slippery wet lace. Nose is lively with dark fruits like dried plum, raisin, fig and molasses. There’s toffee and a sweet caramel. Malty and rich. Has the lightest scent of almonds. Taste is sweet and vibrant. Malty and full with a buttery smooth caramel, toffee and some dark chocolate starting to evidence on this as it warms. Mild roast and a light hop herbal. The body is a bit thin and it’s slick. Finishes dry and with some spicy alcohol. Not enough to say there’s alcohol on the palate as it only warms slightly. The carbonation is ample and a bit strong. 



Great!
On tap at Nik?s Wunderbar. Deep rich brown, malty aroma and oh so smooth. Whatever hops are there offset the heavenly maltiness perfectly, without intruding. Great brew!

A: Dark Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Off White Head, Some Lacing

S: Molasses, Cherry, Plums, Sweet Bread

T: Plums, Sweet Bread, Brown Sugar, Mild Cherry

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Filling

Overall, pretty decent for an out of season bock, nice balance of fruit and malty flavors.
Yeasty Smelling. Surprisingly light poor. Expected a darker beer. Taste was very malty with hints of honey and a bit of a grape juice thing going on.

Oh, Spaten Optimator... it blew my senses. I had high expectations about this beer and I was not dissapointed. It has an overwhelming caramel-roasted-chocolate aroma, it makes you sigh. Its color, very dark, very deep, almost black I can say. Its full and complex body has an equally full and complex flavor, creamy, bitter, roasted. Thanks Germany!

50cl bottle from Systembolaget. Poured mahogany color, thin, lasting beige head. Aroma is very dark bready with some raisins and mild nutty notes. very malty. Flavor has bread, malt, caramel and nuts. Raisins in the long, slightly boozy finish. Excellent doppelbock.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours dark clear copper in color with a tan head. Sweet plums in a 

christmas bowl, lots of dark bready maltyness, some old dry hay and light 

boozyness in aroma. Slightly vinous, dark bready malty notes, overripe raisins and almonds mixed with honey liqour in taste. Some faint bitterness and boozy bready notes in aftertaste.
Sugary aroma, bread maybe? Hint of caramel. Medium amber brown fiizzy minimal head. Sweet , medium body. very soft carbonation.

Block beige head dark brown pour medium carbonation aromas toffee nut strong caramel grain the flavours cereal and grain syrup some toffee caramel nuts oats a milky touch some good malt sharpness in the tastes nice grain the finish a good bock with enough malt richness and good complex flavours to give this a decent mark

Pours black with small head that dissipates quickly. Malty flavor that almost has a spiciness to it. Leaves your mouth with a feeling akin to the afteraffects of smoking a menthol cigarette. Interesting but not my favorite.

Clear amber brown pour with a light lacing head, Aroma is heavy on the malt with notes of booze, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is quite sweet and long lasting with bitter notes to complement the bready malt. Great beer

From a tapered pilsner glass: Sugary aroma: toffee, candi sugars, cola. Heavy molasses. Mildly nutty as well. I’m surprised how much I enjoy this aroma.

Color of diluted Coca-Cola, reddish brown, with a big, creamy head. The head lasts a while too.

Flavor is insanely sweet: toffee, molasses, caramel, candi sugars. The nutty finish is akin to a hazelnut. Not a hop to really be found, but that’s about right for this style. Slightly toasted.

Feels bubbly and carbonated at first, before smoothing out a little. Still, has a rough texture; creamy but NOT smooth. Appropriate. Even in a green bottle in the dead of autumn, this is a really nice choice.

On draught at Prost Oktoberfest / pours pitch black with medium head. Nose of roasted malt and brown sugar. Taste is of sweet malt, caramel balanced with smoke. Sweet brown sugar finish.

One of my all-time favorites. Has a rich, caramel flavor, and ends with a coffee finish.

Serving type: bottle

Appearance- Brown Red with a large golden tan head.

Aroma- A sweet fruit smell with malt

T/P- Very sweet taste of caramel with fruit. Has a little alcohol taste to it but it just adds to the warming effect so it is good.

Overall- Not bad goes down very smooth. Would be very easy to drink a number of these.

16 oz. draft. Slightly hazy dark brown, lots of carbonation thin wispy head. Smell is dark roasted malt, brown sugar, caramel. Taste is very smooth yet malty. Roasted nut notes and caramel and sugar come through. Very enjoyable beer for the fall.

I’m a big dopple bock fan and Spaten Optimator is a prime example of a fantastic dopple bock. Highly recommend!

Serving: Bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a ruddy brown with a small tan head. The nose has a good bit of dried fruit, a little tobacco, and caramel. Malt forward as you might expect with a slight metallic note, spiced fruitcake, and a light bitterness. Alcohol dries things out on the back end despite being a little on the sweet side. Decent.
Outstanding BEER!..got pretty tore up after a six pack.. Id defiantly get it again..Spatten beer you cant go wrong.
Ideal doppelbock. Velvety, greasy mouthfeel and deep malty flavors that linger so sweetly..caramel notes. Just unbelievably smooth and refreshing with some toffee as well. So easy to drink.
Dark brown-red body, thin light tan head, spotty lacing. Raisns, prunes, figs, other dark fruits, and light caramel throughout. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, lingering semi-sweet finish.
Купил на пробу. Так как других д-боков не пил, оценки ставлю средние. Больше брать не буду.

Flaska från Systembolaget . En ovanligt fint balanserad dubbelbock. Frisk och fräsch.

June 2010. From bottle. Dark amber color with a white head. Roasted maly aromas with spice, caramel and fruit. Sweet on the palate.

Dark copper, clear, tan head. Aroma of dark bread crusts, a little toffee, some dark fruit. Flavor is similar with lots of rich, toasty Munich malt, dark fruit, nuts, bready notes, warming alcohol. Easy drinking for a doppelbock. Well made.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel aroma with hints of dark fruit. Flovour of fruit, malts, spices, caramel and dark fruit flavor. Unbalanced, too sweet.

0,3L Bottle. Dark ruby/amber color. Normal white head. Very sweet aroma of grains, caramel and honey. Strong, sweet and rich taste of roasted malt and caramel with long nice bittersweet finish.

On tap at Barley’s in OP, KS. Very similar to Great Divide’s Wolfgang. I don’t enough about dopplebocks to gauge where this rates among them, but this is excellent--nice roasted caramel malt that is sweet, but not treacly.

Dark ruby red appearance. Sweet caramel aroma. Initial taste is sweet malt. Caramel aftertaste, gingerbread-like. Light bitter aftertaste and carbonation. Overall very flavorful and balanced. Could easily have several in a row.

Pours orange amber and clear with a tan head that disappates. Aroma is very malty and nutty sweet. Taste is syrupy, malty sweet - caramel and bread. Finish brings in some hops and bitterness. As a fan of d-bocks, I like this beer but it could be less sweet and more balanced.

Bottle pour at The Beer Trappe in Lexington, KY. Little to no head on a deep amber/brown doppelbock. Very sweet masking any alcohol prevalent. Smooth but slightly flat. Could be an old bottle so I’ll give it the benefit of the doubt. Not something to seek out. Germany can do better.

500 ml bottle. Dark borwn. Medium-sized white head that clings to the glass. Peppery aroma with a strong caramel base. Rich flavours; slightly burnt caramel and toffee. Hints of licorice and dark chocolate. Well balanced. A really nice doppelbock.

Är det såhär en eftersläckning av en villabrand smakar? En vattenskadad och blaskig brändhet trängs med tung alkoholsmak. Nu är det här brandmannajobbet trots allt genomfört med lite finess, men i händerna på vilket deltidskår som helst hade konceptet kunna varit en fullständig katastrof.

Nice and smooth , mildly bitter and smoky. Dark brown to black with small but substantial beige head. Aroma is roast grains, semi sweet chocolate, peat and dried fruit. Taste is mildly sweet with a touch of bitterness. Almost as good as Salvator.....

Good scent. The taste is decent. Good roasted malt but I feel too much alcohol flavor in the beer. Same with the aftertaste. There is too much alcohol taste. Sorry, I thought this would be much better. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
A Doppelbock worth of drinking. Thin head to be noted. Aroma of roast and spice. Strong still not too alcoholic. Medium bitter taste. In comparison to Paulaner Salvator rather mediocre.

Dark brown color with white head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is malty sweet and fruity . Good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från SB som stått i källaren ett knappt år. Mahognyfärgad, klar, lågt skum. Maltsöt doft med marsipan, russin, mörk limpa och mörk sirap. Rund, mjuk och välbalanserad. Visst är den söt men sötman tar inte över och en lätt efterbeska stramar upp smaken väl. Smakbilden liknar doften och gör mig inte besviken. En riktigt bra dubbelbock.

poured almost dark brown with light brown/tan head that quickly disappears. aroma is malt lightly roasted and hints of caramel. the flavor is soooo good. sweet malt, light roasted malt, caramel flavor. decent lacing love this beer.

Flaska från SB. Den här ölen skulle nog ha sparats till jul, med alla dess smakingredienser av diverse julkryddor, russin, gröna äpplen och apelsin. En väldigt mjuk och behaglig sötma. Som sagt, perfekt till julbordet. I aromen hittas fruktkaka, russin, ljus choklad och en lätt stickig alkohol.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with a very thin tan head. The aroma is incredibly rich malt, including chocolate and caramel. There is also a scent of dark fruits such as plum. The taste follows the nose. I’m surprised by how light it feels on the mouth; I was expecting something richer based on the aroma. Doppelbocks tend to be a bit to rich for my tastes, but this certainly isn’t bad.

12 oz Bottle poured Into a mug (I prefer this to when I had it
in a stemmed glass). Don’t detect too much on the nose of the beer, however that’s my untrained nose. Whatever notes are present are certainly pleasant-- chocolate-esque. Great dark but very clean brown oaky color, nearly black. Medium tan head that dissipates pretty quickly. Very smooth on the mouthfeel and taste buds. Great doppel bock. Can easily have more than one; not overpoweringly strong. Good finish
Caramel, toffee, sweet roll aromas, reddish burgundy, nice dense head with moderate lacing, creamy, malty, sweet, prune, raisin, rum flavors, tasty
This bock presents a very complex palate from a simple beer. Ordinary aroma with great color. Finishes well.

Bottle. Rich dark brown with strong tan head. Sweet aromas of cherries, golden syrup, heady malt. Sticky mouthfeel, medium to low carbonation. Delicious flavours of roasted malt, dark fruits, and dark sugar. Sweet but not overly so. Pretty decent dark beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear dark brown with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, bread, brown sugar. Taste is light sweet malty, deep caramel,light roast, smooth, with well hidden alcohol, nice moderate bitter dry end. Very good.
Bottle; Pour a light brown with a foamy white head. Aroma: Molasses/ sweet / dark fruit. Flavor: Molasses/syrup.
Nice malty flavor, fairly simple aroma and palate. Tasty beer but a bit expensive for the quality.
On draught at Prost. Clear light brown color. Drunken cherry aroma with dark malt notes. Taste is grape juice and almost bourbon alcohol notes. Finishes both clean and hearty.
Had a draft of this one at Mars Cheese Castle.  Black brown color. No aroma. Creamy German bock taste. Not my favorite but I don't like this style much either.
Bottled. Pours brown with a small white head. Smells and tastes caramell malty, bread, abit smoky, creamy and well balanced.

500ML served into Sam Adams Perfect Pint glass.

A - Pours a dark russet copper with an active light tan head. Nice clarity.

S - Thick caramel malt, brown bread crust, iron, molasses, creamy marshmallow, prunes.

T - Roasted dark caramel malt, iron, molasses, vinous fruit-plums and grapes, nutty yeast, fresh ground brown bread, grainy bitterness toward the end.

M - Medium carbonation, syrup-like at times, dries off on the aftertaste.

A solid choice for a malty spring Dopplebock. This is widely available and priced right. Super malty and rough enough around the edges to keep it interesting.

Serving type: bottle

03-09-2012

800 yen for a bottle at the Grand Front Building’s Oktoberfest in Osaka. It poured a dark brown with a slight tan head. The aroma is malty sweet with hints of caramel. The taste is sweet, malty with biscuit & oat notes. A really easy drinking doppelbock which seemed better than average to me. It was also one of the cheapest beers available at the fest!

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel aroma with weak hints of dark fruit. Fruity malty spicy caramel and dark fruit flavor. has a fruity malty spicy caramel and dark fruit finish.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel. Flavour is caramel, dried fruit, malt, some hops.
Pours dark brown with thick off white head caramel toffee and malt aromas. Malt, caramel, toffee and yeast flavors. Malty finish.
Dark, malty and a little roasty...really good doppelbock!  As another reviewer called it "very drinkable"!

Bottle. Pours brown with tan head, settles quickly with thin sheets of lacing. Aroma is malty, nutty, toffee, and plum, smells sweet. Flavor is malty, mildly roasted, nutty malt, caramel/toffee, with a fruity finish and a malty aftertaste that lingers. Soft carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture. An enjoyable, drinkable, malty beer.

A quite tasty and unique brew. Pours a beautiful thick dark red with very little head. Smells of cherries and cream. Taste is a little different, a good amount of licorice. Heavier then it looks. Kind of like Negro Modelo if it was a porter.

Ar: jam, dark fruits, butterscotch, toffee, earthy hops, bread, light notes of coffee and roastiness, faint, faint notes of ash, 
Ap: ruby colour, medium tan head, no lacing.

significant roast chocolate smell.  Dark color with clean filtration.  Thin head.  Hearty taste, strong.  Smoke with long lasting palate.  Was looking for a cheaper Celebrator, but it falls short.

Very dark brown pour with medium off white head.  I didn’t pick up too much aroma other than a slight malt.  Very smooth with excellent drinkability.  This is my second dopplebock and im a big fan of this style already.  I can taste an almost sour malty taste that’s perfectly balanced, rich & smooth.  These dopplebocks go down like session beers with no indication of how high the ABV actually is.

Dark copper, clear, tan head.  Aroma of dark bread crusts, a little toffee, some dark fruit.  Flavor is similar with lots of rich, toasty Munich malt, dark fruit, nuts, bready notes, warming alcohol.  Easy drinking for a doppelbock.  Well made.

Bottle. Deep brown body with a ruby taint and a medium off-white bubbly head. Now THAT’s how a doppelbock should look! :-) Aroma is home-made hard caramel ("knekk" in Norwegian), faint nutty tones, caramel malts and hints of red berries far in the back. Taste is burnt sugar, caramel, hints of nuts and bread crumbs. Semi-full body, medium carbonation. OK, but all in all not that awesome considering doppelbock is one of my favorite genres. Maybe I’m just getting picky. ;-)
Drought. Reddish brown with small beige foamy head, caramel aroma, fruity caramel taste, low carbonation, abrupt finish. Very drinkable beer!

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Thich fluffy brown head that lingers. Clear red-brown color. Unpure aroma of vegetables. Rich malty light rosted malts snd also a bit of alcohole present in the taste. Well fermented and no sweet finnish with a full bodie.
Dark amber with light brown head - Good caramel malt aroma - A very good malt body with nice caramel flavour - Lingering sweet malt finish - this was good

Poured with a huge two finger head in an extra wide 0.5 liter Stein. Nose of sweet roasted malt, sweet creamy syrup, with a hint of coffee on the finish. Lovely beer like a wheat beer masquerading as a porter.

Appearance: Clear deep caramel dark brown and subtle color with a big tan head that leaves a nice lacing.
Aroma: Caramel malty and fruity.
Palate: Medium + body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Sweet malty, fruity, vanilla and some roasted malt.
Overall impression: Nice tasty and easy drinkable Doppelbock.
Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden.

Bottle:
Pours clear, deep reddish brown with a small head. Sweet, malty aroma with notes of meat and brown sugar. Smooth, sweet flavor with notes of syrup, salty licorice, honey and toffee. Alcohol bitter finish.

Bottle from Wilbur’s.  Deep reddish brown with a nice tan head.  The aroma is toasted malts, chocolate, caramel and dark fruit.  Medium body with a soft smooth feel and light carbonation.  Flavor is similar to the aroma with a lightly sweet finish.  Pretty good.
Bottle. Reddish brown head with quickly dissipating white head. Roasted malt, caramel, yeasty bread. Taste is sweet roasted malt with caramel and vanilla, dries out, nuttiness takes over.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a dark brownish red with a two inch light tan head.  Taste is of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, brown sugar and bread.  Similar, clean aroma.  Has a mostly full body, with a late, dry body.  Satisfying, enjoyable and easy to drink.
Flaske fra systembolaget. Mørk brun /rødaktig farge, middels skumtopp. Mye malt, karamell, gjær,. En veldig behagelig øl med avrundet smak av malt og karamell

Pours a nice brown with a head that fades in the blink of an eye. Smells of bread and roasted oats. Taste is dark fruits and caramel with a slight hint of alcohol. Palate is a little on the thin side. Overall a nice doppelbock, will try again.

Bottle. A clear red orange colour with a beige head. An aroma of roaste malt and syrup. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. A full body, oily texture and a long sweet and light bitter duration.

Numerous bottles from spirit haus.   Pours light brown with a reddish hue, small off white head.  Nose is malty, light metal/rust, toasted bread.  Flavor is similar, not terribly complex but well balanced for the style and one of the signature beers of the style historically speaking.

Svart med tunt vitt skum som snabbt försvinner.
Tyckte både aroman och smaken var väldigt vaga och tråkiga. Rostade toner med en hint av citron.

500 ml bottle. Dark hazy brown with yellowish head, quickly dissipating. Aroma of burnt sugar, rum, dark bread, alcohol and sweet liquorice. Aromas get a lot stronger with increasing temp. Taste is sweet, bready, sweet liquorice, boozy with rum notes. Finish is with mostly burnt sugar. Very nice beer
500ml bottle. Clear brown with a low brown-tainted head. Pretty ok doppelbock, but I’d take an Ayinger Celebrator any day over this one.
Dark red with beige head. Nice, malty aroma with dried fruits as well. Caramel, raisin tastes along witha hint of holiday spices. Creamy up until the very end when it finishes a bit thin. Quality.

Bottle, 50cl - Clear ruby red brown beer with a large off white head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, bread, dried fruit and nuts. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, nuts, nutmeg and bread. Great

Bottle, pours Reddish Brown, some lacing.  Big Malt nose with background of honey and mild fruits.  Figs and dark fruits, but very mild.  Some metallic showing up in the flavors.  Med to thin body.  Hops balance out the finish from being too sweet.  Overall it lacks richness.  However it is one of the classics.

16.9 fl oz / 500mL bottle into mug. Served cool.

Aroma: Some mild warm caramel and strong malt. Not much else.

Appearance: Transparent dark blood red with a nice thick beige head.

Taste: Pretty tame malt and caramel. Not a lot of character, not a lot of "oomph". 

Palate: Barely creamy. Smooth, but exceptionally light body. Not impressive.

Overall: I was expecting a lot more. The aroma is nice, but shallow. The flavor is good, but weak. The palate is forgettable. Not a great doppelbock. Honestly, a pretty average beer.

Got this for the first time as a college kid by scrolling through a menu and picking the highest abv beer they had. Great beer by the liter! It’s a bit more watery than other doppelbocks, but it is a really smooth drink with a sharp sweetness and it smells like sweet rolls to me.

Aroma: Smelling of molasses, apple, syrup and hay.
Appearance: A clear chestnut colored beer. A   off-white head with some lacing and some curtains.
Taste: Tasting brown toasted bread, apple, bitter orange marmalade and peel.
Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft texture. A big body with a slightly dry finish.
Overall: Very malty, a robust, but sweetish brew.
Note: Bottle 500 ml. Reviewed 2013-04-08.
Dark, almost no head. Thin but malty aroma. Very sweet on the tounge, along with a fiery note from the alcohol.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear orange-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and malty aroma of caramel, hay and brad.
Sweet and malty flavour of caramel, bread and dried fruits.
Sweet finish.

50 cL bottle, thanks to joergen. Pours dark brown with deep amber glare with a small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty, breadish and toasted caramelish. Bitter, toasted malty and breadish. Dry and roasted. Toasted malty caramelish finish.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 5/9/2012.  Pours fairly crystal clear dark reddish brown color with a nice 2 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with moderate streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of caramel, raisin, apple, molasses, toffee, toast, brown bread, floral, brown sugar, light roasted malt, and earthiness.  Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of malt and fruity esters.  Taste of caramel, raisin, apple, molasses, toffee, brown bread, toast, brown sugar, light floral, light roasted malt, and earthiness.  Lingering notes of caramel, light fruits, molasses, toffee, brown bread, toast, and light roast on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance and complexity of malt and fruity ester flavors; with nice robustness and zero cloying sweetness present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a moderately slick and creamy mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with almost zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent doppelbock.  Very nice balance, robustness, and complexity of malt flavors; and very smooth to drink.  A very enjoyable offering.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear nut brown with minimal head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit and toffee. Taste is medium sweet. Caramel and toffee with a hint of red berries. Medium bodied with a oily yet somewhat sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a long, warming finish. Overall, pretty good. Id drink it again.
Det här var en förvånamsvärt rund och slät öl med bra balans och en stabil kropp. Smaken är angenäm med inslag av mörkt bröd, dov fruktighet och lakrits. Slutsats: bra öl och en positiv överraskning.
Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. CLear chestnut, medium beige head. Nutty, caramelly and slightly roasted malt aroma. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.

Pours dark brown with red hue.  White head with no lacing.  Looks like a flat coke.  Aroma of malts and carmel.  Taste is what makes this beer good.  Full bodied.  Carmel and toffee malts dominate with some dark fruit and licorice.

Bottle. Clear, deep copper/ruby/brown liquid with medium light brown head. Aroma of dark fruit, bread, pumpernickel, light chocolate, fruity lager yeast and light noble hops. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of bread, dark fruit and light chocolate. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Balanced beer, really good.

Mörk brunröd öl med ett stort skum. Doften är söt med malt, karamell, mörkt bröd, torkad frukt (framförallt russin) och fikon. Mycket av detta kommer tillbaka i smaken tillsammans med en trevlig nötig beska som avslutning.

Pours clear, medium coffee brown. Fizzy white head, subsides to a lasting froth. Aromas of treacle, caramel, a bit of roastiness, a hint of yeast. Bright but light on the tongue initially, flavor evolves to a medium slightly more roasted malt, and finishes with a lingering hint of darker roast. medium body with a enough fizz to keep it refreshing instead of a coating of flavor. Overall very drinkable, a year round dark session. Great with grilled brats or other wurst.
A great medium dark Doppelbock with balanced malty sweetness with a caramel sting.

7 Feb in my room at The Fishermans Wharf Sheraton in San Fransisco, picked from some all night store round the corner. This beer is wonderful, even out of a plastic beaker!

Deep brown body with a creamy biege head.

The nose is malty sweet: roasted/toasted caramel, red berries, toffee and trees.

The taste is a lovely sweet malty molasses mix: too sweet for some maybe, but not for me, I loved it.

The body is rich and full, the alcohol just about noticeable within the flavours.

A true classic.

Small offwhite head.  Clear dark deep red body.  Earthy caramelly
aroma with red berry and toffee notes.  Dry-sweet earthy mineraly
caramel taste with oily toffee notes.  Full-bodied.  Mild, soft
mouthfeel.  Dryish earthy soy sauce and caramel aftertaste with
dried fruit, red berries, and spice notes.  Nice and drinkable,
but perhaps a bit subdued.  (0.5l bottle, Systembolaget,
Charlottenberg.)

Finns det Spaten Optimator finns det liv. Liksom forna tiders städer alltid grundlades vid strategiska platser bör man, som överlevnadsstrategi, alltid stadfästa sitt eget arsel så nära det här ölet som möjligt. Livets källa är det kanske inte men du kommer att ångra dig bittert om någon annan annekterar de klunkar som flaskan består av.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with some red tints. The thick layer of foam quickly settles into a slight film with beige scum. The aroma is discrete, surprisingly fruity. The taste follows suit with a sweet upfront taste, almost syrupy with citrus side flavors. Then follows some bitterness, probably more driven by roast malts than hops, giving a bitter aftertaste. For being such a strong beer it is surprisingly medium in the body and smoothe. A great beer to be carefull about when you drink it!
Drack annan tysk doppelbock förra helgen. Vad jag minns i stort sett samma upplevelse. Ser fram emot vår/sommarens hefe weiz som jag föredrar.

Dark ruby red, dark brown with a small off white head. Aroma: Rich maltyness, caramel, bread, toasty. Taste: rich breadiness, caramel, clean, slightly bitter. Well hidden alcohol. Sweet with toasted notes. First rated doppelbock! A really nice style. I need to start drinking more German brews! =)

Bottle @ Home. Pours deep golden with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, bread, caramel, berries, little alcohol. Flavor is malt, light wood, caramel, brown sugar, little dark fruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol. 120313
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörk kopparröd färg. Kraftigt skumlock. Doft av karamell, malt och röda bär. Sötman fint balanserad med beskan. Torr snabbt avklingande eftersmak.
Inte igår man drack en bock. Ingen favoritstil direkt. Lagom maltig. Helt ok. Passade bra att bryta av med på provning med div monster

Bottled from Systembolaget
Dark ruby with a large, light beige head.
Malty sweetness with sweet fruits and some sourish notes.
Sweet and malty flavour. Slightly sugary with sweet fruits. Soft and smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle from Systembolaget. A very nice and malty doppelbock. Well hidden alcohol and thick body. Easy to drink as well.
Dark red with a small off white head. Malty and fruity notes. malt, fruit and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear ruby red with a large off-white head. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, dried fruit and some roasted notes. Taste is sweet, crisp with a nice bitterness and some alcoholic notes, Full bodied.

Bottle from SB cons 2013-03-03 Göteborg
AR: bready, burned caramel, plum cake 
AP: dark mahoghny, frothy/stouthy steady creme beige head - wee traces of curtains
F: caramel, butter cake, slippery sugary feeling, soft carbonation, medium bitterness, biscuts texture, finishes caramel bready

Bottle; Thanx to Mr.Rask!
Clear dark cobbery/red colour, big creamy head. Aroma dominates of lots of sweet maltynes, caramelly, and dry fruits. Flavor had a smouth almost creamy mouthfeeling, of caramelly, chocolate, rasins,a little bit vanilla, and a nice bitternes in the end. Medium body, medium bitter finish. Nice Bock beer!!
Ruby with nice generous head. Aroma is caramel malt, dark fruits coffee, chocolate. Taste as aroma + some bitter hops and slight metallic. Body medium. Texture thin, carb soft.

Pours dark brown, two finger thick tan head that dissapates after a few minutes leaving lacing. Full body, carbonated mouthfeel. Alcohol is subtle, but you can taste it. Pretty good, would drink only a couple probably before I switched to something more drinkable.
Very nice very very dark like guiness with a similar sort of skunky taste. Dry pallate with long slightly bitter aftertaste. Taste is very malty almost sweet.

Sampled at the International Great Beer Expo, Rock Hill, NY.

Pours a dark ruby color, dark head, huge bubbles. Almost like coca cola! Nutty aroma, smooth crisp taste. Slightly bitter but pleasing finish. Good drinkability for this type of beer which normally is not my favorite.

Serving type: bottle

Sample at a tasting at Systembolaget, February 2013.

Clear reddish/brown with a white head. Sweet aroma and taste of dried fruit, toffee, malt and some light spices. Nice full body and some warming alcohol. Not a bad one.

Deep amber almost coffee color.   Slightly sweet flavor almost sherry like in its nuttyness.  Slightly acidic around the end of the tounge withh a almost chewy texture. Very malty and a slight hint of yeast in the finish
Excellent Doppel Bock, and widely available due to being owned by InBev. Other than that I do not have anything more to add.

On tap at Abner’s. Pours a clear brown with agray head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of sweet dark grains, sweet bread with a touch of chocolate and light fruit. Flavor is similar with sweet bread and sweet dark grains upfront with a hint of sweet chocolate in the finish.
Chocolate, roast, and a touch of smoke in the nose.  Deep brown with a very small cream colored cap.  Balanced without any distinct hop bitterness.  Full bodied with a bittersweet finish.
Trying to appreciate more German brews. Good nose and flavors of chocolate & roast malts, with some dark fruits & a bitter hop balance. Great!

Bottle to pint.  Looks good for the style; a semi-transparent caramel with thin off-white lacing.  Smells and tastes solid; caramel, toffee, lightly roasted malt, and a hint of dough.  Godd on the palate.  An excellent example of the style.
This beer was good I have never been much for doppel bocks but this one really was pretty tasty

From bottle.  Cola-like appearance with similar carbonation.  Molasses and raisin aroma--can’t detect any hops in the nose.  Good palate; dark fruit and slightly syrupy taste.  Hint of smoke in the finish.  Well concealed ABV.  This is a decent doppelbock, but the aroma is a real distraction for me.

Not my favorite dopplebock, but still decent. It pours a lovely deep brown with a medium head. It tastes slightly sweet, slightly bitter, toffee and molasses. Heavy yeast aroma, which I love. Good partner to heavy meat dishes and rye bread.

Deep mahogany in color. Very clear with a thick khaki head. Rich malt aroma, caramel, no noticeable hop aroma, some raisin and prunes. Thick and chewy. Lot’s of body, Sweet and malty, caramel. Just a touch of bitterness at the end, not much to balance. I haven’t had many dopplebocks. Good to drink a prime example of the style.
Dark brown with light brown head. Smells of caramel raisin.  Sweet caramel raisen taste with a bitter smokey back. Feels a little syrupy,  but in a good way.

500ml bottle.
Pours a dark amber with a beige head.
Malty aroma, caramel, toffee, diacetyl, chocolate, hops.
Off-dry, medium in body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, caramel, fudge, hops, citrus, light chocolate notes.
Well made, not spectacular. (2013-01-15)

Brown with ruby highlights.  Good head and lacing.  Smell sweet dark fruit like raisins with some bread and grain.  Raisin and bready taste with that grain apparent also.  Sweet but not cloying with a tiny bitter aftertaste that I don't appreciate but doesn't detract too much.  Full mouthfeel that is a little sticky with med/high carbonation.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark red pour, smokey caramel smell, tastes similar to smell, good beer on a cold night....     

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours clear dark brown, aroma of grape and prune..taste is good,  some chocolate,  grape,  cream, caramel, pretty all over the place, but awesome
Pours a deep chestnut brown with off white head. Very strong sweet malt and banana aromas. Smoke too. Flavours are almost cloyingly sweet..but a smoky finish balances it out. Interesting.
